English:
(It's a case from a Kamishiro subcontractor. I'll
contact him and ask for details.)
Chinese:
（委託人是神代的外包商嗎……
　總之先連絡他，了解詳細的委託內容吧）
Korean:
(카미시로의 하청업자에게서 온 의뢰…인가.
 일단 연락을 취해서 의뢰 내용을 자세하게 들어보자)
German:
(Das ist ein Fall von einem Kamishiro-Arbeiter.
Ich werde ihn kontaktieren und um genauere
Informationen bitten.)

English: Hello there. Are you a hacker with Hudie?
Chinese:
呦，你好，
你就是hudie的駭客嗎？
German: Hallo. Bist du ein Hacker von Hudie?

English:
My boss told me to find a hacker to handle this
problem, but will Hudie really take on any case?
Chinese:
上頭的人交待說，這類雜務就交給你們駭客，
聽說你們hudie只要委託，
什麼事都願意做，這是真的嗎？
Korean:
이런 류의 잡일은 해커에게 맡기라고 위쪽에서 그러던데
너희 후디에는 의뢰하면
뭐든 해준다는 게 정말이야?
German:
Mein Chef hat mir aufgetragen, einen Hacker zu
finden, der das Problem löst. Nimmt Hudie wirklich
alle Fälle an?

English:
So you'll take on any problem you think you can
solve? That's good to hear! We're in quite a
difficult situation.
Chinese:
喔，只要是駭客能解決的事都行嗎。
真可靠，太好了！說實話，我們真的很困擾啊。
Korean:
호오, 해커가 해결할 수 있는 일이라면 뭐든지라. 든든하네.
다행이다! 사실은 정말 곤란했거든
German:
Du übernimmst also jedes Problem, von dem du
glaubst, dass du es lösen kannst? Gut! Wir sind
in einer schwierigen Lage.

English:
We don't know the cause, but we've had a series of
complaints about a bad smell coming from garbage
data that has been illegally dumped in EDEN.
Chinese:
不知道原因是什麼，
總之最近EDEN中不斷出現非法遺棄垃圾資料，
而且還發出＂惡臭＂的事件。
Korean:
뭐가 원인인지 모르지만, 요즘 EDEN 내에서
불법투기된 쓰레기 데이터에서 "악취"가 난다고
민원이 잇달아서
German:
Wir wissen nicht, warum, aber es gab mehrere
Beschwerden über stinkenden, illegal deponierten
Datenmüll in EDEN.

English: They want us to find and remove it.
Chinese:
希望你能幫忙找出那惡臭根源的資料，
然後將資料刪除。
Korean:
악취 소동의 근원이 되는 쓰레기 데이터를 찾아서
제거해줬으면 해
German: Wir sollen den Müll finden und beseitigen.

English:
I don't understand how data could possibly give
off a bad smell.
Chinese:
啊，你當然會覺得很怪，
資料居然還會傳出惡臭，很怪吧？
Korean:
그래, 물론 데이터에서 악취가 난다니
이상한 이야기지?
German: Ich verstehe nicht, wie Daten stinken sollten.

English:
It's not as if there could be any real garbage in
EDEN, but all the complaints have said that's what
it smells like.
Chinese:
說起來，這EDEN裡不可能會出現廚餘，
但申訴很明確地表示，是跟廚餘類似的味道。
Korean:
애초에 EDEN 안에 썩는 쓰레기가 있을 리 없어.
하지만, 클레임에 따르면 확실히 그런 쓰레기에 가까운
냄새가 난대
German:
Es ist ja nicht so, als ob es in EDEN echten Müll
geben könnte, aber laut der Beschwerden
riecht es so.

English:
I suspect there's some error data disrupting the
EDEN avatars' simulated sense of smell.
Chinese:
我想可能是混入了會讓EDEN化身設定的
模擬感覺……會讓模擬嗅覺出錯的資料吧……
Korean:
아마 EDEN 아바타에 설정되어있는
유사감각…그중에 후각을 이상하게 만드는
에러 데이터가 어딘가에 섞여 들어간 것 같은데…
German:
Ich nehme an, dass es fehlerhafte Daten gibt, die
den simulierten Geruchssinn von EDEN-Avataren
stören.

English:
We try to make the senses in EDEN as realistic as
possible. Although I think we could do without
recreating bad smells.
Chinese:
但就算EDEN以追求真實感受為賣點，
也不用連惡臭也一起重現吧……
Korean:
리얼한 감각이 세일즈 포인트인 EDEN이라고 해도
이런 악취까지 재현하지는 않아도 될 텐데 말이지…
German:
Wir versuchen, die Sinne in EDEN so realistisch
wie möglich nachzuempfinden. Obwohl man Gestank
nicht unbedingt braucht.

English:
But anyway, I need you to find the cause as soon
as possible. The constant complaints are starting
to get in the way of our work.
Chinese:
總之情況就是這樣，
希望你能找出原因來，
一直被申訴也會影響到我們的工作。
Korean:
어쨌든, 그렇게 되었으니까
부디 원인을 알아내줘.
민원에 쫓겨서 우리도 일에 영향을 받고 있거든
German:
Egal, du musst jedenfalls die Ursache so schnell
wie möglich finden. Die ständigen Beschwerden
behindern unsere Arbeit.

English:
The complaints all state that the bad smell is
coming from somewhere in EDEN's public area.
Chinese:
申訴聞到惡臭的地點，
似乎是在EDEN公共區域的某處。
Korean:
악취가 난다는 클레임이 들어온 건
EDEN의 공공 에이리어의 어딘가래
German:
Laut der Beschwerden kommt der Gestank von einem
Teil des öffentlichen Bereichs von EDEN.

English: Let me know if you find anything.
Chinese: 就請你馬上進行調查吧。
German: Sag Bescheid, falls du etwas findest.

English: (A bad smell in cyberspace... What a weird case.)
Chinese: （電腦空間的惡臭……真是奇妙的委託）
German:
(Gestank im Cyberspace ... Was für ein seltsamer
Fall.)

English:
(EDEN's public area... He must mean the Community
Area. I'll head right over.)
Chinese:
（EDEN的公共區域……
　總之先去看看吧）
German:
(Der öffentliche Bereich in EDEN ... Er meint
sicher den Gemeinschaftsbereich. Ich gehe gleich
hin.)
